intro: Chamaesyce arizonica, commonly known as Arizona sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss in harsh conditions. The small yellow flowers bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
